thistown is right, about 240 million abortions have been done world-wide since 1997. 
 
 I believe the best way to discover if abortion is wrong or not is to find out if the fetus is human or not. If the fetus is not human, then I will agree that abortion is perfectly acceptable. But if we find out that the fetus is alive and human, then this will destroy any argument against pro-lifers, since the killing of any human, no matter stance or location, is considered murder. 
 
 But how do we know if the fetus is human? By common sense! Who were the fetus' parents? Human. Who were my dog's parents? Dogs. Do Dogs create any other species besides dogs? No. It is the prinicple of biogenesis that states "every life reproduces after it's own kind". In other words, dogs make dogs; cats make cats; fish make fish; humans only make humans. Thus, if the fetus is not human, it is obviously something else. And it cannot be something else, lest science not be believed. Thus the human is human.

Thus, if the fetus is not human, it is obviously something else. And it cannot be something else, lest science not be believed. Thus the human is human. 
 
 I think you misunderstand the issue. Yes, the question is, is a fetus a human being or is it not a human being. But you are over simplifying it. You ask say that if it is something else then it is not human, but thats not the issue, of course it is human, but is it a human being??? Of course it will  become  a human being (barring miscarriage or abortion), but is it in the first trimester? Second? Third? When does the fetus go from a clump of cells to a human being?? Does it become a HUMAN BEING at the moment of conception when the sperm hits the egg? That point has to be defined and it has yet to be defined somewhere that is satisfactory for both parties. Pro-lifers are all over the board saying the moment of concpetion, when it becomes a zygote, when it becomes an embryo etc, etc, etc. Pro-choicers pretty much agree that it is at the point of viability. When the fetus can survive outside the womb (even with help of modern technology) it is viable and at that point abortion is illegal except in cases where the mothers life is endanger. So the question isn't quite is it human, it is WHEN does it become a human BEING?
 
 Sarah

I think you misunderstand the issue. Yes, the question is, is a fetus a human being or is it not a human being. But you are over simplifying it. You ask say that if it is something else then it is not human, but thats not the issue, of course it is human, but is it a human being??? 

 
 Your proposal makes no sense. Are you speaking human being as in when it is an individual human being? Well then, this is a seperate issue. Let's discuss this. 
 
 
Of course it will become a human being (barring miscarriage or abortion), but is it in the first trimester? Second? Third? When does the fetus go from a clump of cells to a human being??

 
 It's kind of silly that you call it a "clump of cells", as we are all clumps of cells! Everything is made up of cells! Just because it doesn't look like a human being, doesn't mean it isn't one. In fact, there is absolutely no species of any life form that is created in the same form, size, and bodily functions and stays that way. I'm really sorry, but beings don't just pop out of nowhere, they are always there. You didn't evolve from a fetus, you were a fetus. This is philisophically and scientifically sound, and thus you are saying that at one time you were not a human being. This is simply a ludecrous statement, and thus collapses your argument. But now I will forget this, and act as if though I never debated that. I will now answer your question: When does it become a human being?
 
 Firstly, if you mean a personal being, not all children are born with personality. In fact, many babies are born every year with a serious form of brain damage called a vegetative stage. In this stage, the baby is born, as the fetus was, without any personality. The now born baby relies on everybody to feed it, and the baby cannot think, and can only lay flat and at the most move it's eyes (although it is completely blind). In some occations this vegetative person can revive from this horrible mess, although not completely, but it can at least walk around. 
 
 
Pro-choicers pretty much agree that it is at the point of viability. When the fetus can survive outside the womb (even with help of modern technology) it is viable and at that point abortion is illegal except in cases where the mothers life is endanger. 

 
 This belief is stupified by simply understanding this: Everybody relies on something. Simply because the baby cannot survive outside of the mother's womb doesn't mean that the baby isn't human. A baby cannot survive without the mother to feed it and raise it, is the baby not a human until he can graduate from college and have sex by twenty-one? Of course not! A baby is always a human, just like the fetus is always a human. You don't become human, you always are human. You don't need a personality to become a human.

 Your proposal makes no sense. Are you speaking human being as in when it is an individual human being? Well then, this is a seperate issue. Let's discuss this.

My arm is human. It also has human characteristics. The question is, is it a "human being" with rights and interests, that was my point. 
 
 
 It's kind of silly that you call it a "clump of cells", as we are all clumps of cells!

Or if you are religious (I don't know if you are, and I am not even assuming you are I am just saying) when does it recieve a soul???

All your cells do is divide as well. The fetus is simply growing! Give it a chance for Christ's sake!
 
 
Question: Is an egg a human being? Are sperm human beings??

 Um.. no... what does this have to do with anything? Unlike the Egg and Sperm, the fetus has a different genetic code than the parents. The Egg has the mother's genetic code, while the sperm has the father's, but the zygote has it's own. 
 
 
Yes, I was a fetus, and at that point in time I was NOT technically a human being. I had the potential to become a human being but I wasn't not one. I was human cells dividing.

Aug... WHY CAN'T I EDIT MY XXXXXXN POSTS! I copied and pasted from my notepad, and I forgot a piece:
 
 
No I am saying a human being. Human is VERY diffent from human being. The hair that is in the drain of my shower is "human." It has the DNA charicteristics that make me and it human. My arm is human. You actually stay really calm when you argue...congratulations a lot of people on this board can't do that (including myself occaisionally, but arrogance in ignorance just irritates me). 
 
 Just so you know, the things I said were simply to make you aware of pro-choice arguments. You over simplified the issue in your original post by making it sound like the fetus could be couldn't be something else so therefore it must be a human. I was just pointing out that prochoicers obviously believe it is human but they don't believe it is a human being with rights and interests yet, and that is where the argument lies. and I wanted to see if you could clarify your position better, which you did. 
 
 I was actually performing a little experiment of my own, I am in reality a practicing Christian, and a political conservative. I believe abortion is wrong for a lot of reasons. I wanted to see if I understood both sides of the issue well enough to argue either. Because when you can argue the oppositions position you should also be able to refute their position. I have found that I am not very good at arguing pro-choice. Oh well. So yeah, I really can't go on with this discussion because I don't know what else to argue...its really hard to argue something you don't believe.

I thought you were pro-life. I remember you were from the last board (I think it was you... I may be wrong).
 
 What reason do you believe abortion should be allowed? I want to know so I can show you why it shouldn't. :D

I don't think it should be allowed, I just question whether making it illegal would be pushing religious ethics onto others, which is considered wrong it out country. While I can argue pro-life with out bringing religion into it, deep down my opposition to abortion roots from my religion. I am VERY against abortion because I feel you are playing God (same reasons I am against cloning etc.). If the baby is supposed to miscarriage and die before it is born fine, but a person have no right to choose that. If the mother is going to die in childbirth, and the child lives, (or even both die for that matter) then yes, that is said, but people are not God and have no right to act as such. It is God's decision who lives and dies, not pregnant mothers. Since that is the REAL reason I am strongly opposed to abortion, I have to wonder if by thinking abortion should be illegal I am pushing my religious views on others. It is a religious decision, and religious decisions are protected under out Constitutions Freedom of Religion. That's my only problem. 
 
 Of course, if I were raped and I got pregnant, I cannot swear to what I would do, because I have never been in that situation so I cannot say exactly what I would do. I would like to say I would carry the child to full term and put it up for adoption, but I can't guarantee that. I don't think any girl, no matter what religion, background, or belief can honestly stand up and say "I am against abortion, and I will NEVER have one" unless that have been in that situation. Many of us would like to believe we would stick to our morals and trust in God (if religious) but you can't swear that until it happens to you.
 
 So, I don't really think it should be legal, I just question whether it is right under our constitution to make it illegal.
 
 BTW--may I ask if you are a male or female???

Unfortunately you are probably wrong about if the state were to vote. There are a lot of women out there who get abortions, and they obviously aren't going to vote for it, and there are even more who whether or not they would have an abortion themselves believe in the woman's right to choose. I realize there are also a lot of conservative people out there but I am not sure it is the majority. 
 
 Not only that, but the vote would probably never happen in the first place for a lot of reason. One that most people are very ignorant of the arguments for and against abortion. It would VERY quickly turn into an appeal of emotions. Both sides would forget the facts and jump to emotional shock. There would be commercials and adds from the prolife people of bached abortions and sonograms, saying it IS a baby. Talking about how cruel and wrong it is and giving some statistics, but the majority of the adds would be pictures for emotional shock value. Then there would be the prochoicers. They would not only focus on the fact that it isn't a baby, and that a woman has the right to do what she wants with her own body, they would also use slippery slope argument that if we take the right of abortion away all these other rights will be lost. The vote will turn from the issue onto who has the most money to pay for the most ads
 
 Then there would be the whole issue of whether or not men should be allowed to vote about it. Believe it or not it would be a HUGE controversy as to whether or not they should be allowed to. I am not saying it is right, I am just saying it would become an issue and for that reason the vote will probably not happen in the near future if ever.

You're right about the ads, but I think it would be voted illegal. There are a lot of people who have had abortions who wish they wouldn't have had them.

No, not all the Christians would vote against it. I think I would but I am not sure, like I said in a way it is forcing our beliefs on others who are not religious. I mean if the country were primarily Jewish and a vote to make eating non-kosher meat illegal came around, would they vote to make it law. Doubtful, because those are their beliefs and they would not force us to take them in. A lot of Christians would feel the same way. Not only that, but there is the safety issue too, if we make it illegal, they'll just do it anyway, it will just be less safe. It's a lot like prostitution. No a lot of people disagree with it, but a lotof people who disagree with it would still agree that maybe it should be legal because its going to happen anyway and at least if it is legal it is safer.
